1.text: But as for you, speak the things that are consistent with sound doctrine.

2.text: Older men are to be temperate, dignified, self-controlled, and sound in faith, love, and perseverance.

3.text: Older women, likewise, are to be reverent in their behavior, not slanderers or addicted to much wine, but teachers of good.

4.text: In this way they can train the young women to love their husbands and children,

5.text: to be self-controlled, pure, managers of their households, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, so that the word of God will not be discredited.

6.text: In the same way, urge the younger men to be self-controlled.

7.text: In everything, show yourself to be an example by doing good works. In your teaching show integrity, dignity,

8.text: and wholesome speech that is above reproach, so that anyone who opposes us will be ashamed, having nothing bad to say about us.

9.text: Slaves are to submit to their own masters in everything, to be well-pleasing, not argumentative,

10.text: not stealing from them, but showing all good faith, so that in every respect they will adorn the teaching about God our Savior.

11.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to everyone.

12.text: It instructs us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live sensible, upright, and godly lives in the present age,

13.text: as we await the blessed hope and glorious appearance of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ.

14.text: He gave Himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for Himself a people for His own possession, zealous for good deeds.

15.text: Speak these things as you encourage and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you.
